senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of no show; a person who makes a reservation, buys a ticket, or schedules an appointment but does not arrive.

examples.text: The airline did not refund the ticket because the passenger was a <ns>.
We had three <ns> guests at the dinner party last night.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of namespace; a container that provides a context for identifiers (names, or technical terms) to avoid naming conflicts.

examples.text: You should define the variable within the global <ns> to make it accessible everywhere.
The developer organized the code into a separate <ns>.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of native speaker; a person who has spoken a particular language from earliest childhood.

examples.text: The job description requires an <ns> of English for the editing position.
He speaks so well that he sounds like an <ns>.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of Nintendo Switch; a hybrid video game console developed by Nintendo.

examples.text: I brought my <ns> so we can play games on the train.
The new game is available exclusively on the <ns>.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of nuclear ship; a prefix used for merchant or naval vessels powered by a nuclear reactor.

examples.text: The <ns> Savannah was the first nuclear-powered merchant ship.
Engineers monitored the reactor output of the <ns> during the voyage.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of Nova Scotia; a province located in eastern Canada.

examples.text: My family is planning a road trip to <ns> this summer.
Halifax, <ns>, is known for its maritime history.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of New Style; referring to dates calculated according to the Gregorian calendar.

examples.text: The revolution began in October according to the old calendar, but in November <ns>.
Historians often clarify whether a date is Old Style or <ns>.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of nice shot; used to compliment a player's aim or skill in a game.

examples.text: He typed <ns> in the chat after losing the round.

senses.sense_definition: Abbreviation of National Socialist; relating to Nazism.

examples.text: The museum exhibit covered the history of the <ns> party.
Many documents from the <ns> era were destroyed during the war.
